metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.description: Mimecast_TTP_Attachment_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects a threat for an unsafe attachment in an email.
properties.displayName: Mimecast Targeted Threat Protection - Attachment Protect
properties.query:
MimecastTTPAttachment
| where Result != "safe"
| extend SenderAddress = ['Sender Address'] ,RecipientAddress = ['Recipient Address']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 1

properties.displayName: Mimecast Targeted Threat Protection - Attachment Protect

properties.description: Mimecast_TTP_Impersonation_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects a maliciously tagged impersonation.
properties.displayName: Mimecast Targeted Threat Protection - Impersonation Protect
properties.query:
MimecastTTPImpersonation
| where ['Tagged Malicious'] == true
| extend SenderAddress = ['Sender Address'],
  SenderIPAddress = ['Sender IP Address'],
  RecipientAddress = ['Recipient Address']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 2

properties.displayName: Mimecast Targeted Threat Protection - Impersonation Protect

properties.description: Mimecast_TTP_Url_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects malicious scan results and actions which are not allowed.
properties.displayName: Mimecast Targeted Threat Protection - URL Protect
properties.query:
MimecastTTPUrl
| where ['Scan Result'] == "malicious" and Action != "allow"
| extend  From_User_EmailAddress = ['From User Email Address'],MessageID = ['Message ID'] , User_EmailAddress = ['User Email Address']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 3

properties.displayName: Mimecast Targeted Threat Protection - URL Protect

properties.description: Mimecast_Audit_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects threat when logon authentication failure found in audit
properties.query:
MimecastAudit 
| where ['Source IP'] !="" and ['Audit Type'] == "Logon Authentication Failed"
| extend   SourceIp = ['Source IP']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 4
MimecastCG_Attachment_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detect threat for mail attachment under the targeted threat protection.
properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - Attachment Protect
properties.query:
MimecastCG
| where Type == "email_ttp_ap"
| extend  SenderEnvelope = ['Sender Envelope']  , SenderIp = ['Sender IP']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 5

properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - Attachment Protect

properties.description: MimecastCG_AV_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects threats from email anti virus scan.
properties.query:
MimecastCG
| where Type == "email_antivirus"
| extend  SenderEnvelope = ['Sender Envelope']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 6
MimecastCG_Impersonation_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects threats from impersonation mail under targeted threat protection.
properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - Impersonation Protect
properties.query:
MimecastCG
| where Type == "email_ttp_impersonation"
| extend  SenderEnvelope = ['Sender Envelope'] , SenderIp = ['Sender IP']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 7

properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - Impersonation Protect

properties.description: MimecastCG_Internal_Mail_Protect_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects threats from internal email threat protection.
properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - Internal Email Protect
properties.query:
MimecastCG
| where Type == "email_iep"
| extend  SenderEnvelope = ['Sender Envelope']  , MessageId = ['Message ID']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 8

properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - Internal Email Protect

properties.description: MimecastCG_Spam_Event_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects threat from spam event thread protection logs.
properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - Spam Event Thread
properties.query:
MimecastCG
| where Type == "email_spam"
| extend  SenderEnvelope = ['Sender Envelope']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 9

properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - Spam Event Thread

properties.description: MimecastCG_Url_Protect_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detect threat when potentially malicious url found.
properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - URL Protect
properties.query:
MimecastCG
| where Type == "email_ttp_url"
| extend  SenderEnvelope = ['Sender Envelope']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 10

properties.displayName: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway - URL Protect

properties.description: MimecastCG_Virus_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detect threat for virus from mail receipt virus event.
properties.query:
MimecastCG
| where Type == "email_receipt" and isnotempty(['Virus Found'])
| extend  SenderEnvelope = ['Sender Envelope']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 11
MimecastDLP_hold_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects threat for data leak when action is hold
properties.query:
MimecastDLP 
| where Action == "hold"
| extend SenderAddress = ['Sender Address'] ,RecipientAddress = ['Recipient Address']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 12
MimecastDLP_Notifications_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0
Detects threat for data leak when action is notification
properties.query:
MimecastDLP 
| where Action == "notification"
| extend SenderAddress = ['Sender Address'] ,RecipientAddress = ['Recipient Address']

properties.description: Mimecast Analytics Rule 13
Mimecast_Audit_Workbook Workbook with template version 3.0.0

properties.description: Mimecast_AT_Performane_Detail Data Parser with template version 3.0.0

properties.displayName: Parser for Mimecast Awareness Training Performance Details
properties.query:
let dummy_table = datatable(TimeGenerated: datetime) [];
let Awareness_Performance_Details_view = view() {
union isfuzzy=true dummy_table,
Awareness_Performance_Details_CL
| extend ["Email"] = column_ifexists('email_s', ''),
    ["Name"] = column_ifexists('name_s', ''),
    ["Num of Correct"] = column_ifexists('numCorrect_d', ''),
    ["Num of Incorrect"] = column_ifexists('numIncorrect_d', ''),
    ["Num of Not Watched"] = column_ifexists('numNotWatched_d', ''),
    ["User Details"] = column_ifexists('userDetails_s',''),
    ["User State"] = column_ifexists('userState_s',''),
    ["Department"] = column_ifexists('department_s',''),
    ["Time Generated"] = column_ifexists('TimeGenerated','')
    | summarize arg_max(["Time Generated"] , *) by  ["Email"] ,["Num of Correct"] , ["Num of Incorrect"], ["Num of Not Watched"],["Name"]  , ["User Details"] , ["User State"]  ,  ["Department"]
| project  ["Email"] ,["Num of Correct"] , ["Num of Incorrect"], ["Num of Not Watched"],["Name"]  , ["User Details"] ,       ["User State"]  ,  ["Department"]
};
Awareness_Performance_Details_view

let dummy_table = datatable(TimeGenerated: datetime) [];
let MimecastAudit_view = view() {
union isfuzzy=true dummy_table,
Audit_CL
| extend ["Id"] = column_ifexists('id_s', ''),
    ["Audit Type"] = column_ifexists('auditType_s', ''),
    ["User"] = column_ifexists('user_s', ''),
    ["Event Time"] = column_ifexists('eventTime_t', ''),
    ["Event Info"] = column_ifexists('eventInfo_s', ''),
    ["Category"] = column_ifexists('Category',''),
    ["Time Generated"] = column_ifexists('TimeGenerated','')

| project ["Time Generated"]  ,["Source IP"] = IP ,Application , ["Category"] , ["Audit Type"] , ["User"] , ["Event Info"] , ["Event Time"] , ["Id"]
};

connectorUiConfig.title: Mimecast Awareness Training (using Azure Functions)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The data connector for [Mimecast Awareness Training](https://community.mimecast.com/s/article/Azure-Sentinel) provides customers with the visibility into security events related to the Targeted Threat Protection inspection technologies within Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector provides pre-created dashboards to allow analysts to view insight into email based threats, aid in incident correlation and reduce investigation response times coupled with custom alert capabilities.  
The Mimecast products included within the connector are: 
- Performance Details 
- Safe Score Details 
- User Data
- Watchlist Details

graphQueries.metricName: Total Safe Score Details data received

dataTypes.name: Awareness_Performance_Details_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Awareness_Performance_Details_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Awareness_SafeScore_Details_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Awareness_SafeScore_Details_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Awareness_User_Data_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Awareness_User_Data_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Awareness_Watchlist_Details_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Awareness_Watchlist_Details_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
Awareness_Performance_Details_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

Awareness_SafeScore_Details_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

Awareness_User_Data_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

Awareness_Watchlist_Details_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

instructionSteps.description: You need to have a resource group created with a subscription you are going to use.
instructionSteps.title: Resource group

instructionSteps.description:
You need to have an Azure App registered for this connector to use
1. Application Id
2. Tenant Id
3. Client Id
4. Client Secret
instructionSteps.title: Functions app

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Functions to connect to a Mimecast API to pull its logs into Microsoft Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Functions pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/) for details.

>**(Optional Step)** Securely store workspace and API authorization key(s) or token(s) in Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault provides a secure mechanism to store and retrieve key values. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) to use Azure Key Vault with an Azure Function App.

**STEP 1 - Configuration steps for the Mimecast API**

Go to ***Azure portal ---> App registrations ---> [your_app] ---> Certificates & secrets ---> New client secret*** and create a new secret (save the Value somewhere safe right away because you will not be able to preview it later)
instructionSteps.title: Configuration:

instructionSteps.description:
**STEP 2 - Deploy Mimecast API Connector**

>**IMPORTANT:** Before deploying the Mimecast API connector, have the Workspace ID  and Workspace Primary Key (can be copied from the following), as well as the Mimecast API authorization key(s) or Token, readily available.

Use this method for automated deployment of the Mimecast Awareness Training Data connector.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://aka.ms/sentinel-MimecastAT-azuredeploy)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Region**. 
3. Enter the below information : 
		Workspace ID 
		Workspace Key 
		Base URL (Default: https://api.services.mimecast.com) 
		Mimecast Client ID 
		Mimecast Client Secret 
		Log Level (Default: INFO) 
		Schedule (0 0 */1 * * *) 
		App Insights Workspace Resource ID 
4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above**. 
5. Click **Purchase** to deploy.

connectorUiConfig.title: Mimecast Awareness Training (using Azure Functions)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The data connector for [Mimecast Awareness Training](https://community.mimecast.com/s/article/Azure-Sentinel) provides customers with the visibility into security events related to the Targeted Threat Protection inspection technologies within Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector provides pre-created dashboards to allow analysts to view insight into email based threats, aid in incident correlation and reduce investigation response times coupled with custom alert capabilities.  
The Mimecast products included within the connector are: 
- Performance Details 
- Safe Score Details 
- User Data
- Watchlist Details

graphQueries.metricName: Total Safe Score Details data received

dataTypes.name: Awareness_Performance_Details_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Awareness_Performance_Details_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Awareness_SafeScore_Details_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Awareness_SafeScore_Details_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Awareness_User_Data_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Awareness_User_Data_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Awareness_Watchlist_Details_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Awareness_Watchlist_Details_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
Awareness_Performance_Details_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

Awareness_SafeScore_Details_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

Awareness_User_Data_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

Awareness_Watchlist_Details_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions on the workspace are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

customs.name: Azure Subscription
customs.description: Azure Subscription with owner role is required to register an application in Microsoft Entra ID and assign role of contributor to app in resource group.

customs.name: Microsoft.Web/sites permissions
customs.description: Read and write permissions to Azure Functions to create a Function App is required. [See the documentation to learn more about Azure Functions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/).

customs.name: REST API Credentials/permissions
customs.description: See the documentation to learn more about API on the [Rest API reference](https://integrations.mimecast.com/documentation/)

instructionSteps.description: You need to have a resource group created with a subscription you are going to use.
instructionSteps.title: Resource group

instructionSteps.description:
You need to have an Azure App registered for this connector to use
1. Application Id
2. Tenant Id
3. Client Id
4. Client Secret
instructionSteps.title: Functions app

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Functions to connect to a Mimecast API to pull its logs into Microsoft Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Functions pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/) for details.

>**(Optional Step)** Securely store workspace and API authorization key(s) or token(s) in Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault provides a secure mechanism to store and retrieve key values. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) to use Azure Key Vault with an Azure Function App.

**STEP 1 - Configuration steps for the Mimecast API**

Go to ***Azure portal ---> App registrations ---> [your_app] ---> Certificates & secrets ---> New client secret*** and create a new secret (save the Value somewhere safe right away because you will not be able to preview it later)
instructionSteps.title: Configuration:

instructionSteps.description:
**STEP 2 - Deploy Mimecast API Connector**

>**IMPORTANT:** Before deploying the Mimecast API connector, have the Workspace ID  and Workspace Primary Key (can be copied from the following), as well as the Mimecast API authorization key(s) or Token, readily available.

Use this method for automated deployment of the Mimecast Awareness Training Data connector.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://aka.ms/sentinel-MimecastAT-azuredeploy)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Region**. 
3. Enter the below information : 
		Workspace ID 
		Workspace Key 
		Base URL (Default: https://api.services.mimecast.com) 
		Mimecast Client ID 
		Mimecast Client Secret 
		Log Level (Default: INFO) 
		Schedule (0 0 */1 * * *) 
		App Insights Workspace Resource ID 
4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above**. 
5. Click **Purchase** to deploy.

connectorUiConfig.title: Mimecast Audit (using Azure Functions)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The data connector for [Mimecast Audit](https://community.mimecast.com/s/article/Azure-Sentinel) provides customers with the visibility into security events related to audit and authentication events within Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector provides pre-created dashboards to allow analysts to view insight into user activity, aid in incident correlation and reduce investigation response times coupled with custom alert capabilities.  
The Mimecast products included within the connector are: 
Audit

dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
MimecastAudit_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
MimecastAudit_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

>**(Optional Step)** Securely store workspace and API authorization key(s) or token(s) in Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault provides a secure mechanism to store and retrieve key values. **STEP 1 - Configuration steps for the Mimecast API**

connectorUiConfig.title: Mimecast Secure Email Gateway (using Azure Functions)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The data connector for [Mimecast Secure Email Gateway](https://community.mimecast.com/s/article/Azure-Sentinel) allows easy log collection from the Secure Email Gateway to surface email insight and user activity within Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector provides pre-created dashboards to allow analysts to view insight into email based threats, aid in incident correlation and reduce investigation response times coupled with custom alert capabilities. Mimecast products and features required: 
- Mimecast Cloud Gateway 
- Mimecast Data Leak Prevention

connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The data connector for [Mimecast Targeted Threat Protection](https://community.mimecast.com/s/article/Azure-Sentinel) provides customers with the visibility into security events related to the Targeted Threat Protection inspection technologies within Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector provides pre-created dashboards to allow analysts to view insight into email based threats, aid in incident correlation and reduce investigation response times coupled with custom alert capabilities.  
The Mimecast products included within the connector are: 
- URL Protect 
- Impersonation Protect 
- Attachment Protect

dataTypes.name: Ttp_Url_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Ttp_Url_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Ttp_Attachment_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Ttp_Attachment_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Ttp_Impersonation_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Ttp_Impersonation_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
Ttp_Url_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

Ttp_Attachment_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

Ttp_Impersonation_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

customs.name: Azure Subscription
customs.description: Azure Subscription with owner role is required to register an application in Microsoft Entra ID and assign role of contributor to app in resource group.

customs.name: Microsoft.Web/sites permissions
customs.description: Read and write permissions to Azure Functions to create a Function App is required. [See the documentation to learn more about Azure Functions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/).

customs.name: REST API Credentials/permissions
customs.description: See the documentation to learn more about API on the [Rest API reference](https://integrations.mimecast.com/documentation/)

instructionSteps.description: You need to have a resource group created with a subscription you are going to use.
instructionSteps.title: Resource group

instructionSteps.description:
You need to have an Azure App registered for this connector to use
1. Application Id
2. Tenant Id
3. Client Id
4. Client Secret
instructionSteps.title: Functions app

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Functions to connect to a Mimecast API to pull its logs into Microsoft Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Functions pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/) for details.

>**(Optional Step)** Securely store workspace and API authorization key(s) or token(s) in Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault provides a secure mechanism to store and retrieve key values. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) to use Azure Key Vault with an Azure Function App.

**STEP 1 - Configuration steps for the Mimecast API**

Go to ***Azure portal ---> App registrations ---> [your_app] ---> Certificates & secrets ---> New client secret*** and create a new secret (save the Value somewhere safe right away because you will not be able to preview it later)
instructionSteps.title: Configuration:

instructionSteps.description:
**STEP 2 - Deploy Mimecast API Connector**

>**IMPORTANT:** Before deploying the Mimecast API connector, have the Workspace ID  and Workspace Primary Key (can be copied from the following), as well as the Mimecast API authorization key(s) or Token, readily available.

Use this method for automated deployment of the Mimecast Targeted Threat Protection Data connector.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://aka.ms/sentinel-MimecastTTPAzureDeploy-azuredeploy)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Region**. 
3. Enter the below information : 
		Workspace ID 
		Workspace Key 
		Base URL (Default: https://api.services.mimecast.com) 
		Start Date 
		Mimecast Client ID 
		Mimecast Client Secret 
		Log Level (Default: INFO) 
		Schedule (0 0 */1 * * *) 
		App Insights Workspace Resource ID 
4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above**. 
5. Click **Purchase** to deploy.
instructionSteps.title: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template
